metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27921 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Pillow before 8.1.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) because the reported size of a contained image is not properly checked for a BLP container, and thus an attempted memory allocation can be very large.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5
python-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5
python3-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5
python3-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Jiayi Lin, Luke Shaffer, Xinran Xie, Akshay Ajayan

notes.Note: mdeslaur> while this is mentioned in the 8.1.1 release notes, it doesn't seem to be mentioned in the CHANGES file, and I can't seem to locate the commits that fix this in 8.1.1 vs 8.1.0 This was actually fixed in 8.1.2.

criterions.comment: pillow package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5').
